name: centrism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
political beliefs or policies that are at the centre of the range of political opinions: His strategy generally values consensus and centrism over ideology. The new Prime Minister was urged to move leftwards, away from his predecessor's centrism. Related word
centrist
More examplesFewer examplesMany analysts today believe that centrism and even liberalism is virtually dead.Some in the party could be tempted into an arch-conservative revolt against her centrism.He sees them as pointlessly clinging to the fraying labels of "liberalism" (now most often wishy-washy centrism) and "conservatism" (which has taken a radically hard-right turn).Some Republicans were dissatisfied with his centrism, saying "He wasn't partisan enough."

the fact of having a particular type of person, place, or thing as your most important interest; the quality of being seen from the point of view of a particular type of person, place, or thing: The Academy has been accused of Eurocentrism and gender bias. The artist's newest ventures embody his commitment to ecocentrism. Related word
